KPIs.title: Proposal Clearance
KPIs.description: For the governance process to function properly, all proposals must be processed effectively, and in a reasonable time frame to avoiding blocking new proposals coming in.
successEvents: At no point will the number of active proposal stay at 5 for longer than 14,400 blocks (~24h).
No malicious or unreasonable proposals are approved.
KPIs.annihilation: Unlike other 'annihilations', failure for this KPI will result in the loss of ALL KPI rewards, and a new Council Election will be started immediately.

KPIs.title: Council Reporting
KPIs.description: There needs to be some level of accountability and transparency for the Council. For each Term the Council must produce a report of 'events' and 'Tokenomics' to allow users to make informed votes. This must be submitted as a PR to the Community Repo.
successEvents: The Council on Babylon (#2073601-#2275201) produces a report based on the 'Council Reporting Template' and the 'Tokenomics' script
KPIs.annihilation: Unlike other 'annihilations', failure for this KPI will result in the loss of ALL KPI rewards.

KPIs.title: Appoint New Council Secretary
KPIs.description: The Council must appoint one of their own as the Council Secretary, responsible for adding Council Reports and representing the Council in the Community Repo (with some enhanced repository maintenance privileges).
successEvents: The Council informally appoints a Council Secretary through a spending proposal and pays them an appropriate rate for their responsibilities.
The spending proposal must provide a link to the Council Secretary's GitHub account so we can provide them 'triage' permissions on the community repo.

KPIs.title: Research Max Validator Change
KPIs.description: After the validator set was increased last week, there was some unexpected behaviour. Produce a report answering the following questions:
successEvents: After the proposal was executed (#1937365), how quickly did the new validators show up?
Was there any clear patterns for the new validators?
Did the number of network nodes increase 'proportionally'? (Might be hard to figure out, unless you've configured your node to accept >80 peers.)
What happened to the rewards in tJOY and USD terms?
Was there a spike in tokens staked, or were they just shifted?
What happened to the average block time, and blocks per era and session/epoch?

KPIs.title: Managing Community Bounties
KPIs.description: Managing Community Bounties will be a growing part of the Council's workload. Establishing good workflows for this will be iterative and situational.
successEvents: Update/fix/maintain the Community Repo's new `bounties-overview` files (json, table issue)
Follow the instructions for each bounty, create the forum posts, follow up and, if required, create budgets, request funding and hire/assign members as managers.
Submit a weekly bounty report, outlining the status and progress for each bounty.
KPIs.annihilation: Unlike standard `annihilations`, any rewards paid for a Bounty that exceeds what Jsgenesis pays will be deducted from the Council's KPI rewards.
